title: Samsung rides high on AI boom, cautions global headwinds ahead
description: "The ongoing AI boom is expected to continue driving favourable market conditions across the industry" in the first quarter of 2026, Korean giant Samsung said in a statement. This statement signifies the company's optimism, as it reported record-breaking numbers. As the race to develop artificial intelligence strains chip supply and drives up costs, Samsung Electronics reported that its operating profit more than tripled to a record high in the fourth quarter and predicted robust chip demand going forward.
content: The leading memory chipmaker in the world has tremendous pricing power, as evidenced by the results, and its profit growth is expected to pick up speed this quarter. However, the company also issued a caution for the volatility ahead as a result of f... [2985 chars]

title: Is AI behind slow hiring in the US? Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell says…
description: Noting that job gains remained slow despite the US economy being on ‘firm footing’, Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell said there was ‘some connection’ between a sluggish labour market and artificial intelligence. However, he warned against rushing towards macroeconomic conclusions.
content:
Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell on Wednesday (local time) appeared more upbeat about the US economy, saying it was on a “firm footing”, but was more equivocal about artificial intelligence (AI) and its impact on jobs and growth.
“The US economy e... [3815 chars]

title: Survey suggests link between chatbot dependency and depression
description: People who frequently consult artificial intelligence outside work could be more prone to depressive symptoms than others, according to a team of researchers led by doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital and Weill Cornell Medical School.
content:
People who frequently consult artificial intelligence outside work could be more prone to depressive symptoms than others, according to a team of researchers led by doctors at Massachusetts General Hospital and Weill Cornell Medical School.

title: U.K. proposes letting websites refuse being included in Google's AI search
description: Website publishers, particularly media outlets, say artificial intelligence pilfers their content without compensation to feed its models.
content:
Britain's competition watchdog proposed Wednesday that websites be allowed to opt out of having their content be used by Google's "AI Overviews" feature as it tackles the technology giant's dominance in online search.

title: Tesla invests $2 billion in Musk's xAI and reiterates Cybercab production starts this year
description: Tesla said on Wednesday it will invest $2 billion in CEO Elon Musk's artificial-intelligence company xAI - and that production plans for its Cybercab robotaxi were on track for this year.
content: On Wednesday, Musk told analysts on a conference call that Tesla would stop selling its Model S sedans and Model X SUVs - flagship vehicles that once established the company as a leader in the EV market but have since dwindled to account for a small ... [6114 chars]

title: DeepSeek Sets Sights on AI Search and Agents, Job Postings Show
description: DeepSeek is looking to broaden its AI offerings with new artificial intelligence search features and more emphasis on agents, ramping up competition with US firms like OpenAI and Alphabet Inc.’s Google.
content:

content:

title: U.S. Chipmaker Nvidia's Controversial AI Assistance to China
description: U.S. chipmaker Nvidia is under scrutiny for aiding China's DeepSeek in developing AI models used by the Chinese military. Concerns arise as Nvidia's technical support helped improve DeepSeek's efficiency despite U.S. restrictions on chip sales to China, potentially eroding U.S. competitive advantage in artificial intelligence.
content: U.S. chipmaker Nvidia is facing criticism for its role in aiding China's DeepSeek, a firm that later used its artificial intelligence models for military purposes. This development was highlighted by the chairman of a U.S. House committee, who expres... [748 chars]
